body: emm weird i can't reproduce this crash with your reproduce step..

No jump is necessary, nvim crashes by just `:bw` the opened buffer.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/b79ff967ac91dce40f3598ea407c5ccaa2929250/runtime/lua/vim/diagnostic.lua#L2873-L2879

It seems that `ev.buf` is expired after `:bw` i.e. still pointing the deleted buffer.

I am not sure if relevant, but I use

- CC: GCC 15.1.1
- LuaJIT: bundled one (2.1.1753364724)

there should check buffer is still valid before calling `nvim__redraw` in callback

```
if api..nvim_buf_is_valid(ev.buf) then
  vim.api.nvim__redraw({ buf = ev.buf, statusline = true }) 
end
```

issue.title: fix(statusline): check buf valid before redraw

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
#33723 introduced an issue where it could attempt to redraw an already deleted buffer that causes an error 

fixes #35116

issue.title: fix(diagnostic): check if the buffer is loaded

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
> Even if a buffer is valid it may have been unloaded.

fix #35116

body:
I don't think this addresses the root cause of the crash.

What I think is happening is the `DiagnosticChanged` autocommand calling `nvim__redraw` is invoked via `on_detach` at a bad time; there's an issue where `close_buffer` triggers `on_detach` after `buf_freeall` while there's still a window temporarily open to the closed buffer.

Rebasing #34024 seems to fix the crash without the need for extra checks; I need to get around to finishing it, though.
(To be clear, I'm not against checking `nvim_buf_is_loaded` for now as a workaround)

issue.title: fix(api): on_detach consistently before buf_freeall autocmds

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem: on_detach may be called after buf_freeall and other important
things, plus its textlock restrictions are insufficient. This can cause issues
such as leaks, internal errors and crashes.

Solution: disable buffer updates in buf_freeall, before autocommands (like the
order after #35355 and when do_ecmd reloads a buffer). Don't do so in
free_buffer_stuff; it's not safe to run user code there, and buf_freeall already
runs before then; just free them to avoid leaks if buf_freeall autocommands
registered more for some reason.

Fixes #28084
Fixes #33967
Fixes #35116
